title: Bourgeoisie
summary: The bourgeoisie (/ˌbʊərʒ.wɑːˈziː/; French: [buʁʒwazi] (listen)) is a sociologically defined social class, equivalent to the middle or upper middle class. They are distinguished from, and traditionally contrasted with, the proletariat by their relative affluence,[1] and their cultural and financial capital. They are sometimes divided into a petty  (petite), middle (moyenne), grand (grande), upper (haute), and ancient (ancienne) bourgeoisie (which are collectively designated "the bourgeoisie").
